Class Position

java.lang.Object
iscteiul.ista.battleship.Position
All Implemented Interfaces:
iscteiul.ista.battleship.IPosition
public class Position extends Object implements iscteiul.ista.battleship.IPosition
Represents a position on the Battleship game board. A position is defined by its row and column coordinates within the board. Each position keeps track of: - Whether it is occupied by a ship - Whether it has already been hit by a shot The Position class is a fundamental element of the game model, used by ships, the fleet, and the game logic to manage board state.

  • Constructor Details

    • Position

      public Position(int row, int column)
      Creates a new position with the specified coordinates. The position is initially: - Not occupied by any ship - Not hit by any shot
      Parameters:
      row - the row index of the position
      column - the column index of the position

    • equals

      public boolean equals(Object otherPosition)
      Compares this position with another object for equality. Two positions are considered equal if they share the same row and column coordinates, independently of their state (occupied or hit).
      Specified by:
      equals in interface iscteiul.ista.battleship.IPosition
      Overrides:
      equals in class Object
      Parameters:
      otherPosition - the object to compare with
      Returns:
      true if both objects represent the same board coordinates, false otherwise

      Specified by:
